git.description: Distributed version control system used for source code management. It should, normally, be installed previously as the dotfiles are normally installed through it, but, just in case, it is included.

zsh.description: A powerful interactive shell with advanced scripting capabilities, often used as a Bash alternative. I am part of that often, for ricing purposes mainly, but some functionality as well.

curl.description: Command-line tool for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting various protocols including HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, and more. I should learn more about using CURL, but, for now, it is used as the installation tool for some other packages.

build-essential.description: Meta-package in Debian-based systems that installs essential tools for building software, including gcc, g++, make, and others. Given that it is a set of essential tools for compiling and building software, including GCC, G++, Make, and development headers, I searched for equivalents on Google and the package to it.

libstdc++-12-dev.description: Development files for the GNU Standard C++ Library, providing headers and libraries required to compile C++ programs.Lacking this gave me a three hour headache when I was learning to configure neovim for cpp coding, so, praise the package.

cmake.description: Cross-platform tool for managing the build process of software using compiler-independent configuration files. I love this thing. Perhaps it's lack of experience with it and I might grow to hate it one day, but, for now, my cpp experience depends on it.

tree-sitter.description: Parser generator tool and incremental parsing library used for syntax highlighting and code analysis.

openjdk-17-jdk.description: Open-source implementation of the Java Platform, Standard Edition — includes the JDK, compiler, and development tools for Java 17.

nvim.description: Neovim is a hyperextensible Vim-based text editor. This installs the latest available release or nightly build.

ripgrep.description: Fast command-line search tool written in Rust that recursively searches your current directory for a regex pattern. Necessary for some neovim utilities.

fd-find.description: A simple, fast and user-friendly alternative to 'find', installed via cargo and symlinked locally. Again, needed for some extra functionalities in neovim.

luarocks.description: A package manager for the Lua programming language used to install and manage Lua modules. Neovim requested this of me and I was not about to deny it to it.

python3-pip.description: Python package installer for Python 3, used to manage and install Python modules from PyPI.

neovim-pip.description: Python client for Neovim, required for Python plugin support in Neovim.

ruby-dev.description: Development headers for Ruby, needed to build native extensions such as Neovim's Ruby provider.

neovim-gem.description: Ruby host for Neovim, required for running plugins written in Ruby.

gh.description: GitHub CLI for managing repositories, issues, pull requests, and workflows from the terminal.

docker.description: Docker Engine and Docker Compose CLI plugin, used to build and run containers. Required for containerized development and deployment workflows.

fnm.description: Fast and simple Node.js version manager, used to manage multiple Node versions. Installed via a custom script since it's not available through default package managers. It’s required for managing versions cleanly and used by tools like tree-sitter.

node.description: Node.js runtime environment, required for tools like tree-sitter and Neovim plugins. Installed via fnm to allow easy version management and consistency across environments.

neovim-npm.description: Node.js provider for Neovim, installed via npm as a global package. Required for Neovim plugins that depend on Node functionality.

lazygit.description: A simple terminal UI for Git commands, useful for quickly staging, committing, and reviewing changes from the command line. Great for speeding up Git workflows inside terminals or Neovim.

tree.description: Command-line utility that recursively displays directory contents in a tree-like format. Useful for quickly visualizing folder hierarchies.

fzf.description: A general-purpose command-line fuzzy finder, used for interactive filtering and selection of items such as files, commands, and processes.

sqlite3.description: Command-line interface for interacting with SQLite databases, commonly used for development, scripting, and lightweight storage tasks.

mmdc.description: CLI tool for rendering Mermaid.js diagrams to images (SVG, PNG, PDF). Installed via npm and useful for documentation workflows.

dotnet.description: CLI interface for the .NET SDK, used to develop and run applications using C#, F#, and VB.NET. Required for building and running .NET projects.

go.description: Compiled programming language developed by Google, known for its simplicity, performance, and built-in concurrency. Required for Go-based tooling such as language servers or linters.

php.description: Widely-used general-purpose scripting language especially suited for web development. Required for installing and running PHP tools like Composer.

composer.description: Dependency manager for PHP used to manage project libraries. Required for installing PHP packages in modern web development environments.

httrack.description: Command-line utility for downloading entire websites for offline browsing. Useful for archiving and mirroring static web content.

python-modules.description: Essential Python modules including setuptools and venv, installed through system package managers to support virtual environments and module management.

fish.description: A smart and user-friendly interactive shell, with autosuggestions, syntax highlighting, and scripting support. Used as an alternative to Bash or Zsh. Needed for some functionality in LazyVim.

lynx.description: Text-based web browser for the terminal, useful for browsing or testing websites in CLI environments, including limited-resource or SSH-only systems.

rustup.description: Rust toolchain installer and version manager. Installs `cargo`, `rustc`, and `rust-std`. Required for compiling Rust projects and managing Rust versions.

kitty.description: GPU-accelerated terminal emulator with ligature, image, and tab support. Known for high performance and good font rendering, used in riced terminal setups.
